cloudText: If you have teenaged drivers, using a cell phone while driving is the equivalent of driving drunk, even when using a hands-free phone.
It may be tempting to eat, drink, flip the radio dial, or play loud music while driving. However, these distractions can easily lead to accidents.
Check your owner's manual to know your vehicle's weight limit. Exceeding the limit can damage your vehicle and lead to accidents.
If you use a car top carrier, to prevent unstable steering and braking, be sure to pack a stable load with evenly distributed weight.
If carrying things on your car roof (bicycles, cargo carriers, ski racks, etc.), measure the height and watch for clearance height signs.
Never leave your pet unattended inside of your car. Cars can heat up very fast, even with the windows cracked!
